intro: Neocardenasia, commonly known as the Brazilian star-of-Bahia, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to South America, particularly Brazil. These plants are characterized by their attractive, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white, yellow, or red. The leaves are usually opposite and often have a velvety texture. Neocardenasia species are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and as houseplants.
